root: Top-level sections mirror the README: defaults, pipelines, modules, database, webui, alerts, and baseline. Each block is independent, so keep indentation consistent and prefer spaces over tabs.
defaults: defaults: global knobs applied to every module unless overridden. Good place for llm_min_severity and max_chunk_lines.
defaults_llm_enabled: defaults.llm_enabled: gate LLM payload generation everywhere by default. Flip to false to disable payloads globally.
defaults_llm_min_severity: defaults.llm_min_severity: minimum severity to emit LLM payloads; WARNING in the README example. Use DEBUG/INFO/WARNING/ERROR/CRITICAL.
defaults_max_chunk_lines: defaults.max_chunk_lines: cap chunk size before grouping/LLM to avoid giant payloads; typical values range from 120-500.
pipelines: pipelines: reusable grouping + classifier bundles referenced by modules via pipeline_name. Keep names short and lowercase.
pipelines_match: pipelines.match.filename_regex: regex to pick which files feed this pipeline. Use anchors to avoid accidental matches.
pipelines_grouping: pipelines.grouping: choose whole_file or marker to define chunk boundaries. For marker, set start/end strings per the README grouping section.
pipelines_classifier: pipelines.classifier: regex_counter or rsnapshot_basic; set error/warning/ignore regex lists. Make regexes specific to avoid noise.
pipelines_llm: pipelines.llm: enable per-pipeline payloads, set min_severity, max_chunk_lines, and optional prompt_template paths. Set enabled: true to turn it on.
pipelines_ignore: pipelines.classifier.ignore_regexes: drop known noisy lines before counting severities.
modules: modules: concrete tasks; each ties a path + mode to a pipeline and output options.
modules_path: modules.path: source log file or directory (batch) pulled by logtriage. Ensure the service can read it.
modules_mode: modules.mode: batch scans once, follow tails a file, stream tails with interval, journal reads systemd logs. Match the README examples.
modules_pipeline: modules.pipeline: name of a pipeline entry; controls grouping/classifier used on this module.
modules_output_format: modules.output_format: json or text summaries written by the CLI.
modules_llm_payload_mode: modules.llm_payload_mode: errors_only or fullâ€”matches README guidance on LLM payload size.
modules_only_last_chunk: modules.only_last_chunk: true to only analyze most recent chunk per file (e.g., last rsnapshot run).
modules_exit_code_by_severity: modules.exit_code_by_severity: map severity to process exit codes for automation.
modules_alerts: modules.alerts: optional webhook/mqtt sinks; match README examples for headers, topics, and min_severity.
modules_baseline: modules.baseline: anomaly detection window and multipliers controlling severity adjustments.
modules_stream: modules.stream: stream/tailing settings like from_beginning and interval.
database: database: URL + retention_days. Web UI and CLI must share this to show per-module stats.
database_retention_days: database.retention_days: how long to keep historical chunks before cleanup.
webui: webui: host/port/base_path plus security (secret_key, allowed_ips) and admin_users with bcrypt hashes.
webui_admin_users: webui.admin_users: usernames + password_hash fields. Update via Password page or regenerate hashes.
webui_allowed_ips: webui.allowed_ips: IP allowlist for the UI; empty list means allow all. Add addresses as strings.
webui_secret_key: webui.secret_key: long random string used for session signing; rotate to sign everyone out.
webui_session_cookie_name: webui.session_cookie_name: customize cookie name to avoid clashes behind reverse proxies.
alerts: alerts: webhook + MQTT hooks; follow README examples for headers, topics, and min_severity.
baseline: baseline: enable baseline detection, window size, and multipliers controlling anomaly severity bump.
